title: Where should I study law, England or the US? - Quora

Colleges and Universities in the United States of America

response.answer_text: You study in the place where you wish to eventually practise law. If you study in the USA, your law qualifications are American and therefore allows only American practice. Same story if studying in the UK. Lex loci — the law of the land. Law doesn’t travel. You practise from which you studied. To practise law in another country while holding the legal qualifications of another, you’ll need “dual qualifications” (i.e. conversion of one legal qualifications for recognition and practice in another).
